events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - San Diego
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands-On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop!

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prize

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page.

Agenda

Session I – Overview

  • ·Metro Style Apps Overview
  • ·Developing Metro Style Apps
  • ·Working with Controls
  • ·Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • ·Working with Location
  • ·Data Binding
  • ·Roaming
  • ·App Bar 

Session III – Metro Principals

  • ·Live Tiles & Toast
  • ·Contracts
  • ·Full, Fill Snap and Portrait Views
  • ·Advertising

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • ·1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • ·2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • ·3rd Place: $100 Gift Card 

“Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • ·$10,000 from Component Art
  • ·Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc.

 In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reilly

events.name: Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge - San Diego, CA
events.about:
Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge

 

Headphones on. Tilt the seat back. Just steady codin’ as the keys get tapped. Get ready, because Nokia Developer is about to turn your town into Dev City with its Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge.

 

We are hitting the road to 13-cities looking for developers who want to build an experience not just another app. To kick off the Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge, Nokia Developer will hold hackathons across the US and Canada beginning in May. You can sign up individually or form your own team to build the coolest, baddest apps for the Windows Phone platform and Nokia Lumia devices.

 

Prizes will be awarded on site at each event for the top 3 created apps, top student created app, and most Nokia-branded developer (use your imagination). App winners will be judged on creativity, usability, technical difficulty and app presentation.

 

1st place:                                                $500 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

2nd place:                                               $250 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

3rd place:                                               $100 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

Student Winner:                                   $150 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

Most Nokia-Branded Dev:                  $100 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

 

At Nokia, we don’t have ordinary developers, so these won’t be ordinary hacks. We have some amazing experiences in store – like our Re-Charge Room - for developers to chill out between pounding out code. So come showoff your skills and earn rewards. Space will be limited so register early.

The Challenge is on. . . .Ready.Set () {Code}

 

Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge Schedule:

08:30 a.m.             Light breakfast and registration

09:00 a.m.             Welcome and competition overview

09:30 a.m.             Let the hacking begin!

12:30 p.m.             Lunch

07:00 p.m.             Show us your app/Dinner

08:00 p.m.             Winners announced

 

See rules here:

http://www.callingallinnovators.com/readysetchallenge/SanDiego

events.name: Hack Night #1: Ideation & startup teams forming; OC Hackerz
events.about:
Join us for a hack night # 1

Pitch your ideas and form teams for your startup, in preparation for OC Hackerz Hackathon. Software developers, coders, designers, UI/UX experts, mobile developers, business developers/MBAs, startups and ideas generators, hardware tinkers and hackers are welcome! Bring your laptops as well with PowerPoint or Adobe PDF presentations of your ideas. Plan 2-4 minute pitches.

A hackathon (also known as a hack day,hackfest or codefest) is an event in whichcomputer programmers and others in the field ofsoftware development, like graphic designers,interface designers and project managers, collaborate intensively on software-related projects.[1] Occasionally, there is a hardware component as well.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hackathon

 

 

Location:

Microsoft Store *South Coast Plaza*

3333 Bristol Street , Costa Mesa, CA 92626

Park behind MS Store, at South Coast Plaza parking structure. Parking is FREE.

RSVP & bring your friends athttp://www.meetup.com/OCHackerz

events.name: Apps Challenge Hack Day
events.about:
What is SD Apps Challenge:

(from website) Mayor Sanders and the City of San Diego are challenging the software developer community to create new apps using city and partner data. Winners will receive $50,000 in cash prizes as well as promotional exposure. Prizes will be awarded for apps that enhance city services and quality of life for San Diegans, and that use the data in innovative ways.

For more information: http://sdappschallenge.com/

What is Apps Challenge Hack Day:

We want to bring both developers and idea people together to come up with innovative apps to enter into the SD Apps Challenge. The schedule is very loose with little fluff to maximize time to hash out ideas, create teams, and then begin work.

Schedule:

10:00-10:30 - Show up, sign in, and mingle.

10:30-11:00 - Introductions and SD Apps Challenge explanation from City Rep.

11:00-11:30 - Idea Quick Pitch

11:30-12:00 - Collaborate and form teams

12:00-? - Teams are welcome/encouraged to continue to work at Ansir Center

What To Do Before You Come:

1) Go through SD Apps Challenge website and data sets

2) Come up with some ideas using specific data sets

3) Bring your laptop/computer

4) Bring an open mind and willingness to work with others

Sponsors 

Organizers 
Tim Ryan, StoryofAStartup.net
Wesley Quach, Ansir Innovation Center

events.name: Code Across America: Open San Diego Hack Day
events.about:
Come out and set up two apps for San Diego as part of Code for Americas Code Across America event.

Well be setting up the following two apps:

  • Open Data Catalog - a portal to San Diego datasets
  • ArtAround - a public art mapper

More details coming soon, but please RSVP if you can make it out!

events.name: BlackBerry Hackathon San Diego
events.about:
When and Where?

The Hackathon will take place on Saturday February 25th, from 9AM-7PM, at the newest UCSD Extension facility: University City Center, 6256 Greenwich Drive, San Diego, CA 92122 (Parking: Free)

The opportunity to turn your ideas into reality arrived with the brand new Blackberry Hackathon in San Diego, on February 25 2012. 

Start planning your app, develop it in one day, meet people, meet the experts from BlackBerry, have fun and earn prizes!

Every team member who develops an app during the BlackBerry Hackathon in San Diego, and presents it in the end, gets a FREE BlackBerry PlayBook Tablet 16GB.

Prizes and Categories

Each winning team will receive one brand new BlackBerry device.

The categories are:

- Best App

- Best Game

- Best E-Commerce App

- Best User Interface Design

Apps will be judged based on the the criteria below and weighted accordingly:

25% Weight - Viability of business model

25% Weight - Design quality

25% Weight - Originality of idea

25% Weight - Fully functioning PlayBook App

Each team will have 3 minutes to present its PlayBook app. 

Schedule:

9 am – 9:30 am: Arrivals and breakfast

9:30 am – 10:00 am: Introductions and presentation

10:00 am – 5:00 pm: Open hacking time

5:00 pm – 7:00 pm: 3 minute presentations

7:00 pm – 7:30 pm: Awards and closing

* Maximum 5 people per team

Technologies you can use

NDK for Tablet OS using C, C++, Open GL ES 2.0 in 2D & 3D

WebWorks SDK for Tablet OS using HTML5, CSS & Javascript

Tablet OS SDK for Adobe AIR using ActionScript, Flash or Flex

More details at: https://bdsc.webapps.blackberry.com/devzone/

Did You Know?

BlackBerry is the number one in smartphone platform in Latin America and number two in the world?

BlackBerry has 75 million subscribers?

There are over 20,000 registered developers in BlackBerry App World?

BlackBerry App World has 6 million downloads of apps per day?

Most BlackBerry apps users are between 18 and 34 years?

BlackBerry App World is available in 164 markets and growing?

BlackBerry App World has 60,000 apps available (while Apple has 500,000 and Android Market has 400,000)? Threat or an opportunity?

Users buy more apps on BlackBerry App World than on Google Android Market?

BlackBerry App World apps generate 40% more revenue for their developers than Android apps?

13% of BlackBerry app developers earn over $100,000, more than the revenue of Apple and Android developers?

If you develop today for the BlackBerry PlayBook, your application will automatically be ready to run in BB10 (the brand new operating system for the next generation of BlackBerry smartphones)? 

Good luck and happy coding!
